intro: Bichenia plicata, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Bichenia plicata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its unique morphology makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
